Detailed Description

A utility class used to keep counts of DRM objects seen and to print DRM class names in different styles.

With this class you can:

  • Keep track of DRM classes used by an application by calling increment() to increment the count for a class, and getCount() to retrieve its current value.
  • Retrieve text friendly versions of class names:
    • standard spaced: Model Library (see getName())
    • underscore style: Model_Library (see getUnderscoreName())
    • short style: ModelLibrary (see getShortName())
  • Use convenience methods to set and free the string values in the SE_String and SE_URN data types.

The following example demonstrates the use of this class to keep track of the DRM class of objects being processed: 

seHelperDRM my_counts;

while (some loop)
{
    if (some flag to check for DRM class type)
        my_counts.increment(type);
}

// show results/counts:
cout << "Total of " << my_counts.getCount() << " matches" << endl;

for ( int i = 1; i < SE_DRM_CLASS_UBOUND; i++ )
{
    if ( my_counts.getCount(i) > 0 )
        cout << seHelperDRM::getName(i) << " has " << my_counts.getCount(i) << endl;
}

The following example demonstrates the use of this class to set and free SE_String values: 

SE_String some_str = SE_STRING_DEFAULT;

seHelperDRM::setSE_String(some_str, "String value 1");
... use some_str
seHelperDRM::setSE_String(some_str, "String value 2");
... use some_str
... free when no longer needed
seHelperDRM::releaseSE_String(some_str);

Note:
To maintain multiple counts of object classes, use as many seHelperDRM instances as needed.
Author:
Warren Macchi

Member Function Documentation

long sedris::seHelperDRM::increment ( SE_DRM_Class  type  ) 

Increments the count for a specific type.

Use this method to increment by 1 the current count for the specified DRM class type.

Returns:
The current count for the type.

static void sedris::seHelperDRM::setSE_String ( SE_String &  dest,
const SE_String &  src 
) [static]

Frees previous SE_String values and sets a new one.

Allocates the characters in an SE_String and sets length as needed.

Warning:
The SE_String passed in must be initialized prior to using this method (e.g. my_str = SE_STRING_DEFAULT) or a memory access error will occur when the memory is freed.
Parameters:
dest in/out: the destination SE_String to set
src in: the source SE_String

static void sedris::seHelperDRM::setSE_String ( SE_String &  str,
const SE_Character *  chars,
SE_Short_Integer_Unsigned  len = 0,
SE_Locale  locale = SE_LOCALE_DEFAULT 
) [static]

Frees previous SE_String values and sets a new one.

Allocates the characters in an SE_String and sets length as needed.

Warning:
The SE_String passed in must be initialized prior to using this method (e.g. my_str = SE_STRING_DEFAULT) or a memory access error will occur when the memory is freed.
Parameters:
str in/out: the SE_String to set
chars in: the character data
len in (optional): the length of the character data, or 0 to let it be computed based on the NULL terminating character in chars
locale in (optional): the locale for the string. Default is the SEDRIS default locale
